title: Tess and Claudia Say Goodbye to Strictly Come Dancing
summary: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman are presenting Strictly Come Dancing for the last time on Christmas Day. They have been hosting the show together for over ten years. The Christmas Special will air on BBC One, where six couples will dance under the glitterball. In October, they surprised fans by saying they would leave after this series. People are now guessing who might replace them, with names like Zoe Ball and Rylan being mentioned. Tess started on the show 21 years ago, and Claudia joined in 2014. They are the first female duo to host a prime-time Saturday night show. They said hosting was a dream and they will miss it. The BBC calls this the end of an era.

background_read: Strictly Come Dancing is a popular British TV show where celebrities learn to dance with professional partners. It airs on BBC One and has been on for over 20 years. Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman are well-known hosts who have made the show fun for families. They work together on Saturday nights, and many people watch it as a tradition. Their leaving is a big change for the show, and fans are curious about what will happen next.
